Description: A bowl of pale green-grey marlware pottery, with a ring-foot, convex sides and everted, flat-topped rim. A slight ridge runs around the perimeter below the rim. A small part of the rim has been damaged. The interior and exterior were originally covered by a smooth pale green slip but only small areas of this survive.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 52, south-eastern quarter of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp"), area of ironsmith's workshops.
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 52 has been scratched into the side of the vessel.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 66 § 61, pl. xxxiv, 15)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.93, fig.9, p.102, p.190, pl.32)
